notes.text:
Use a meat thermometer for perfect doneness
Make sure mushrooms are completely dry
This is a showstopper - perfect for special occasions

steps.descr: Sear beef on all sides, brush with mustard, let cool

on_enter.say: Right, let's get that beef sizzling! Sear it on all sides until it's beautifully browned, then brush it with a nice layer of mustard. Let it cool down a bit before we move on.

steps.instructions: Sear beef on all sides, brush with mustard, let cool

steps.descr: Cook mushrooms until all liquid evaporates, season well

on_enter.say: Now let's cook those mushrooms. We want to get rid of all the liquid, so keep stirring until they're nice and dry. Season them well for that extra flavour.

steps.instructions: Cook mushrooms until all liquid evaporates, season well

steps.descr: Lay ham on plastic wrap, spread with pâté and mushrooms

on_enter.say: Let's lay out the Parma ham on some plastic wrap. Spread it with a lovely layer of pâté and then our cooked mushrooms. This is going to be delicious!

steps.instructions: Lay ham on plastic wrap, spread with pâté and mushrooms

steps.descr: Wrap beef in ham layer, refrigerate 30 minutes

on_enter.say: Now, let's wrap that beef up in the ham layer. Pop it in the fridge for thirty minutes to let it set nicely.

steps.instructions: Wrap beef in ham layer, refrigerate 30 minutes

steps.descr: Wrap in puff pastry, seal edges, brush with egg

on_enter.say: Let's get that beef wrapped up in the puff pastry. Make sure to seal the edges well, and give it a nice brush with egg yolk for that golden finish.

steps.instructions: Wrap in puff pastry, seal edges, brush with egg

steps.descr: Bake at 200°C for 35-40 minutes until golden

on_enter.say: Time to bake! Preheat your oven to two hundred degrees celsius, that's about three hundred ninety-two degrees fahrenheit. Pop it in for thirty-five to forty minutes until it's beautifully golden.

steps.instructions: Bake at 200°C for 35-40 minutes until golden

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Let it rest for ten minutes before slicing. This is really important - it lets all those lovely juices redistribute.

recipe.title: Beef Wellington
recipe.description: Luxurious beef fillet wrapped in puff pastry with mushroom duxelles
